review_title: New patch fixed this game for me
one_reviews_text:
Game has gotten much better with the latest 1GB patch, is the draw distance now the same as the launch version? 
At least performance seems never to have been better.
Fugl requires a 64-bit 4+ core processor, but using my i7 7700+ cpu (4 cores, 4.5 GHz) I had no problem getting solid 90 fps even with all graphics (view distance) maxed. I also cranked up super sampling to 2.0 and still got solid 90 fps. Fugl isn't much of a game, maybe it's more an experience - or even a tech demo, because you simply fly and experience the different worlds and landscapes (or swim as a fish). Fugl is a Nordic word meaning "bird". In Fugl you transform into other life forms when you fly next to them - maybe the flying monkey is taking the logic a bit too far, but it's fun becoming a butterfly, bat or other birds (or fish). 
Maybe $15 is a high price for the limited and repetitive experience, but the voxel worlds simply look fantastic. Personally I find Fugl a great way to relax - and kids won't have much trouble controlling and enjoying Fugl too.  Touch works nicely like a gamepad. Fugl is a highly recommended VR experience.

review_title: You will overlook this title... shame!
one_reviews_text:
1st Impressions Video with Commentary // Oculus Rift CV1 // GTX 1060 (6GB):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nLT99v-i-KI
(Please Note: Links might not work from Oculus so please search YouTube for 'Paradise Decay VR Fugl')

My Quick Thoughts:
Fugl is not an action packed game, it's one of wonder and exploration. It has a really unique voxel artstyle which feels great in VR as you soar through the worlds in search of all the creatures to morph into.

Fugl is a treasure.  A game that doesn't have a million rules or play mechanics.  You fly around different biomes and morph into flying creatures along your journey.  You do this to soothing ambient music.  This game has helped me to relax from stressful days and unwind my brain from complexities.  I highly recommend it to anyone that is tired of shooters and high octane games and just needs some time to relax and take flight.

review_title: 4 stars but it's not the games fault
one_reviews_text: It's yours because this game is not what your looking for, there is no story or game here only a basic colectathon but if you just came to soar like a pixalated eagle or flit like a butter fly through endless randomized world to chill out then you wont find a better one in vr.

Response to Developer:  Increasing the Turn Speed only seemed to enable the bird to get out of my FOV faster.

Original Review: The other reviews are spot on for the kind of game/experience it is; wide-open areas to fly around in, take in the sights, and relax (a VR Sunday Drive, for old timers). No goals, no objectives, no worries. A great way to wind down a VR session.
The graphics are simplistic, but leave no doubt about what you are seeing.  It is probably due to the simple nature of the graphics that I am allowed to increase the Draw Distance to the maximum, and have no performance issues (i7-8700, 16GB RAM, GTX 1070Ti).
What i do have an issue with is the following: (1) The inability to lock your position behind the bird. So, effectively, although you control the bird, too wide of a turn, and you will have to physically turn to keep track of the bird.  Otherwise, the bird will fly out of your field of view, and you will be confused as to what happened, and why you seem to keep crashing into things without knowing where your bird is at. (2) A 1st-person view, for myself, would add a lot of immersion and control.  I enjoy the casual flying around, but there are times I want to see how well I can fly (as compared to how well I can control the bird).
I saw this game as being what I wish Eagle Flight could have been (thank goodness this game has no blnders when turning), and it almost works for me, minus the issues described above.
Fixing these control issues would easily take it to a 4 or 5 star game.

one_reviews_text:
This is a really tranquil experience which should appeal to anyone who just likes exploring a landscape. In addition to morphing into lots of different types of birds, you can also morph into various types of fish and swim around underwater, and other types of animals.

The graphics and audio are really lovely and relaxing, and the controls are pretty intuitive and easy to use.

This is definitely something I'll be coming back to play more of, especially now that I noticed in the trailer/description that you can find mythical creatures!
